trustfund:
TF071783-Co-financing of the Fifth
            Economic Reform Support Grant

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth Economic Reform Support Grant
            (ERSG V) is the second in a programmatic series of two
            operations (the first operation of the series, ERSG IV, was
            approved in December 2010), designed to help the Government
            of Burundi (GoB) to consolidate recent efforts to transform
            Burundi's economy from a post-conflict to a sustainable
            development oriented economy. In practice, these efforts
            consist to formulate and implement policies to accelerate
            growth and promote human development, including through
            private sector development. At the conclusion of the ERSG
            IV-V programmatic series, tangible progress with respect to
            each component of the reform program is expected, including:
            (i) measurable improvements in public finance management;
            (ii) measurable improvements in the environment for private
            sector development, with a focus on improved performance of
            the energy sector; (iii) progress in the liberalization of
            the productive sector, including the execution of the reform
            program in the coffee sector; and (iv) measurable progress
            towards coping with the effects of an ongoing fuel and food crisis.
